timeline.bodyText: One minor point that it might be good to mention here: Hidden indices are also included for wildcard expressions that start with a dot, e.g. .watcher-history*. This was done in part to mirror the Unix globbing behavior for dot files, and in part because indices that start with a dot must be either hidden or system indices in 8.0+.

+// tag::hidden-index-def[]
+An index that is excluded by default when you access indices using a wildcard expression. 
+To include hidden indices, you must specify the `expand_wildcards` parameter.

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure if this is relevant because I'm not sure what branches this is aimed at, but this will only be true for 8.0+, for 7.x you can access/modify system indices, but doing so is deprecated.
